member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do if an with the specified name already exists in the current folder when you create a new file or folder.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.FailIfExists
member.summary: Throw an exception.
member.remarks: Windows.Storage specifies that the exception will be a , but we can be more specific in the exception type.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.GenerateUniqueName
member.summary: Automatically append a number to the base name of the new file or folder.
member.remarks: For example, if the folder MyFolder (2) already exists, the resulting folder will be MyFolder (3), and if the file MyFile.xaml.cs does, the new one will be named MyFile (2).xaml.cs.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.OpenIfExists
member.summary: Return the existing item.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: Replace the existing item.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageFile

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageFile.ContentType
member.summary: Get the MIME type of the file contents.
member.value: The type in standard MIME format; for example, audio/mpeg.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageFile.FileType
member.summary: Gets the type of the file as declared by its extension.
member.value: The file extension; for example, jpg.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageFile.OpenAsync(AgEitilt.Common.Storage.FileAccessMode)
member.summary: Opens a random-access stream over the file.
member.remarks:
Warning: This is not fully compatible with Windows.Storage as it returns a rather than the modern IAsyncOperation<...>. Additionally, the value type returned by awaiting that task is a rather than a IRandomAccessStream; this is particularly dangerous because the former doesn't guarantee as strongly that reading from it will result in that number of bytes.
TODO: Expand the package to include that interface, to avoid any issues that may occur.
member.param: The type of access to allow.
member.returns: A stream providing access to the data within the file, once the completes.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem
member.summary: Manipulates storage items (files and folders) and their contents, and provides information about them.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.Attributes
member.summary: Describes the properties of a storage item.
member.remarks: Warning: This is not fully compatible with Windows.Storage as the enum it returns is instead in the namespace. This is actually a near-superset of Windows.Storage.FileAttributes, but does not include the item LocallyIncomplete.
member.value: The attributes of the file or folder.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.DateCreated
member.summary: Gets the date and time the current item was created.
member.remarks:
For the date and time of the last edit, see .
Warning: This is not fully compatible with Windows.Storage as that will always return a valid (though potentially zero) instance of . This change was made to provide clearer semantics, taking advantage of the builtin support for .
member.value: The date and time the current item was created, or null if this information is not included on the file; for example (in string format), "Fri Sep 16 13:47:08 PDT 2011".

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the storage item, including (if it exists) the file extension.
member.value: The full name of the file or folder.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.Path
member.summary: The full path of the file on the file system, if it is located in such an accessible place.
member.remarks: Do not rely on this property to access an item because some items may not have file-system paths. For example if the item is backed by a URI, or was picked using the file picker, the item is not guaranteed to have a file-system path.
member.value: The full path of the item (including its name), or an empty string if it is not physically identifiable on the file system.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.DeleteAsync(AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption)
member.summary: Removes the current item from disk.
member.remarks: Warning: This is not fully compatible with Windows.Storage as it returns a simple rather than the modern IAsyncAction.
member.param:
Whether to always skip the Recycle Bin and permanently delete the item, or if that decision should rely on the default behaviour.
Default value is the latter ().
member.returns: An awaitable , with no associated value.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.GetBasicPropertiesAsync
member.summary: Gets the basic properties of the current item.
member.remarks: Warning: This is not fully compatible with Windows.Storage as it returns a rather than the modern IAsyncOperation<...>.
member.returns: The basic properties describing the item, once the completes.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.IStorageItem.IsOfType(AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageItemTypes)
member.summary: Determines whether the current item is of the specified type.
member.param: The value to match against.
member.returns: true if the item is , otherwise false.

member.summary: Renames the current item.
member.remarks: Warning: This is not fully compatible with Windows.Storage as it returns a simple rather than the modern IAsyncAction.
member.param: The name under which the item will try to be saved. If a file of this name already exists in this folder, the behaviour is determined by .

The method used to handle situations where a file by the name of already exists in this folder.
Default value is .
member.returns: An awaitable , with no associated value.
member.exception: A file by the name of already exists and is .
(as appended to the folder path) is longer than allowed by the file system.
is not a valid name for the file system.
This file is deleted before the returned finishes.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do if a file or folder with the desired name already exists in the destination when you copy, move, or rename an item.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.FailIfExists
member.summary: Throw an exception.
member.remarks: Windows.Storage specifies that the exception will be a , but we can be more specific in the exception type.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.GenerateUniqueName
member.summary: Automatically append a number to the base name of the new file or folder.
member.remarks: For example, if the folder MyFolder (2) already exists, the resulting folder will be MyFolder (3), and if the file MyFile.xaml.cs does, the new one will be named MyFile (2).xaml.cs.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: Replace the existing item. This will delete any contents if the existing item is a folder.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.ReplaceOrMerge
member.summary: If both the existing item and the one being moved or copied are folders, merge the children of both (replacing any files that share the same name). Otherwise, this functions identically to .
member.remarks: This is an extension on the Windows.System enum.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.NameCollisionOption.MergeAlongside
member.summary: If both the existing item and the one being moved or copied are folders, merge the children of both (generating new names for any files that share the same name according to the rules described for ). Otherwise, this functions identically to .
member.remarks: This is an extension on the Windows.System enum.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption
member.summary: Specifies whether a deleted item is moved to the Recycle Bin (or the platform equivalent) or permanently deleted.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption.Default
member.summary: Use the default behaviour.
member.remarks:
TODO: Describe the decisions made to determine behaviour. For reference, on Windows 10:
If the item is in application storage (accessed through ApplicationData), then permanently deleted
Delete according to default behaviour of File Explorer for the particular save location

member.name: F:AgEitilt.Common.Storage.StorageDeleteOption.PermanentDelete
member.summary: Permanently deletes the item. The item is not moved to the Recycle Bin.
